remarks: The predicate "is a T_0 space."  Every pair of distinct points is topologically distinguishable.  For the way this definition is usually encountered, see ~ ist0-3 .  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 1-Feb-2010.)
statement:
ist0.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
ist0 $p |- ( J e. Kol2 <-> ( J e. Top /\ A. x e. X A. y e. X ( A. o e. J ( x e. o <-> y e. o ) -> x = y ) ) ) $.
$d J o x y $.
$d X o x y $.
